column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Specialist Anaesthesiology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Specialist in Anaesthesiology, you play a critical role in ensuring patient safety and comfort during surgical procedures or medical interventions     Here's an overview of the responsibilities and skills typically associated with this specialization:Preoperative Assessment: Conducting thorough evaluations of patients' medical history, physical condition, and current medications to determine their suitability for anesthesia     Assessing and managing any pre-existing medical conditions that may impact the anesthesia plan     Anesthesia Administration: Administering various types of anesthesia, such as general anesthesia, regional anesthesia, or local anesthesia, based on the specific needs of the patient and the surgical procedure     Monitoring vital signs and adjusting anesthesia levels throughout the procedure to ensure the patient's comfort and safety     Pain Management: Implementing effective pain management techniques before, during, and after surgical procedures     This may involve administering pain medications, regional anesthesia techniques, or employing advanced pain management modalities     Patient Safety and Monitoring: Constantly monitoring patients' vital signs, including heart rate, blood pressure, oxygen saturation, and respiratory status during anesthesia     Responding promptly to any changes or complications, and taking appropriate measures to maintain patient stability     Emergency Situations: Being prepared to handle emergencies or complications related to anesthesia, such as adverse reactions, allergic responses, or cardiopulmonary events     Having the knowledge and skills to perform resuscitation procedures and manage critical situations effectively

column2: Role & responsibilities    Caring of patients at the remote ICUs from a centralized care center in Bengaluru  Conducting tele rounds which involve patient review, daily rounds, review of labs and radiology, drug charts, compliance to protocols  Liasing with the bedside team actively and providing assisting the Intensivist to augment delivery of critical care to the ICUs  Check-ins with regular intermittent tele rounds on sick patients and initiating appropriate actions with the help of the tele ICU nursing team in collaboration with the bedside team  Actively participate in quality initiatives directed at the betterment of the remote ICUs in the our network and contribute to the teams effort  Documenting patient level data and communication in our smart ICU platform, RADAR  Contributing and participating in inhouse academic activities  At our on-ground hospitals in Bengaluru:  Acting as registrar while on a shift.  You will report to the on call consultant while on a shift  Responsible for clinical management, procedures, liasing with other consultants and patient and family counseling  Participating in any meetings, quality projects, academic activities while on shift as a representative of our hospital MD in Anesthesia/Internal Medicine OR MBBS+CTCCM+IDCCM. Perks and benefits   CTC based on last drawn If interested kindly share your cv at akshaya.balaji@sapwood.net
column11: Anesthesia, Anaesthesiologist, remote ICU, ICU, Assistance

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for SpeSpecialist - Paediatrics & Neonatology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Specialist in Paediatrics & Neonatology, your role is to provide specialized medical care to infants, children, and adolescents     You will focus on diagnosing, treating, and managing a wide range of pediatric conditions, ensuring the health and well-being of your young patients       Here are some key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:       Clinical Evaluation and Diagnosis: Conduct comprehensive assessments of pediatric patients, including taking medical histories, performing physical examinations, and ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests     Use your expertise to diagnose and treat various pediatric conditions     Neonatal Care: Provide specialized care to newborns in the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) or special care nursery     Monitor the health and development of premature infants or those with complex medical needs, and coordinate multidisciplinary care for neonates     Treatment Planning and Management: Develop treatment plans tailored to the individual needs of pediatric patients     Prescribe medications, order and interpret laboratory tests, and coordinate with other healthcare professionals to provide comprehensive care     Preventive Care and Vaccinations: Promote preventive care by monitoring growth and development, providing vaccinations according to the recommended schedules, and offering guidance on nutrition, safety, and well-child care     Chronic Disease Management: Manage chronic conditions that affect children, such as asthma, diabetes, congenital heart diseases, and developmental disorders     Monitor patients' conditions, provide ongoing care, and coordinate with specialists as needed

Aster Medcity is looking for Specialist Anaesthesiology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Patient Assessment: Evaluate patients before procedures to assess their medical history, current health status, and anesthesia requirements     Anesthesia Planning: Develop individualized anesthesia plans based on patient needs, the type of procedure, and other factors, considering the choice of anesthesia (general, regional, local, or sedation)     Anesthesia Administration: Administer anesthesia to induce and maintain a controlled state of unconsciousness or sedation, ensuring patients are pain-free and immobilized during surgery     Monitoring: Continuously monitor patient vital signs, anesthesia depth, and other parameters throughout the procedure to ensure patient safety     Pain Management: Provide pain relief and pain management solutions during and after surgery, tailoring pain control methods to each patient     Emergency Response: Be prepared to respond to medical emergencies, such as an adverse reaction to anesthesia or unexpected complications during surgery     Perioperative Care: Oversee patients during the entire perioperative period, including preoperative assessment, intraoperative management, and postoperative care     Collaboration: Work closely with surgeons, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to ensure a safe and efficient surgical environment     Patient Education: Educate patients about the anesthesia process, potential risks, and expected outcomes, addressing any questions or concerns     Post-Anesthesia Care: Provide post-anesthesia care, monitoring patients as they recover from the effects of anesthesia and ensuring a smooth transition to the postoperative phase     Research: Stay updated on advancements in anesthesiology, participate in research studies, and contribute to the development of best practices     Compliance: Ensure that all anesthesia practices adhere to regulatory requirements, ethical standards, and patient safety guideline
